  • deepof.data module

deepof.data moduleÔÉÅ

Data structures for preprocessing and wrangling of DLC output data. This is the main module handled by the user. There are three main data structures to pay attention to: - Project, which serves as a configuration hub for the whole pipeline - Coordinates, which acts as an intermediary between project configuration and data, and contains a plethora of processing methods to apply, and - TableDict, which is the main data structure to store the data, having experiment IDs as keys and processed time-series as values in a dictionary-like object.

For a detailed tutorial on how to use this module, see the advanced tutorials in the main section.

class deepof.data.Project(arena_dims: int, animal_ids: List = ('',), arena: str = 'polygonal-manual', arena_detection: str = 'rule-based', enable_iterative_imputation: bool = True, exclude_bodyparts: List = ('',), exp_conditions: Optional[dict] = None, high_fidelity_arena: bool = False, interpolate_outliers: bool = True, interpolation_limit: int = 2, interpolation_std: int = 3, likelihood_tol: float = 0.85, model: str = 'mouse_topview', path: str = '.', smooth_alpha: float = 1, table_format: str = 'autodetect', frame_rate: Optional[int] = None, video_format: str = '.mp4')ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Class for loading and preprocessing DLC data of individual and multiple animals. All main computations are handled from here.

__init__(arena_dims: int, animal_ids: List = ('',), arena: str = 'polygonal-manual', arena_detection: str = 'rule-based', enable_iterative_imputation: bool = True, exclude_bodyparts: List = ('',), exp_conditions: Optional[dict] = None, high_fidelity_arena: bool = False, interpolate_outliers: bool = True, interpolation_limit: int = 2, interpolation_std: int = 3, likelihood_tol: float = 0.85, model: str = 'mouse_topview', path: str = '.', smooth_alpha: float = 1, table_format: str = 'autodetect', frame_rate: Optional[int] = None, video_format: str = '.mp4')ÔÉÅ

Initializes a Project object.

Parameters:

  • arena_dims (int) ‚Äì diameter of the arena in mm (so far, only round arenas are supported).

  • animal_ids (list) ‚Äì list of animal ids.

  • arena (str) ‚Äì arena type. Can be one of ‚Äúcircular-autodetect‚Äù, ‚Äúcircular-manual‚Äù, or ‚Äúpolygon-manual‚Äù.

  • arena_detection (str) ‚Äì method for detecting the arena (must be either ‚Äòrule-based‚Äô (default) or ‚Äòcnn‚Äô).

  • enable_iterative_imputation (bool) ‚Äì whether to use iterative imputation for occluded body parts. Recommended,

  • slow. (but) ‚Äì

  • exclude_bodyparts (list) ‚Äì list of bodyparts to exclude from analysis.

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì dictionary with experiment IDs as keys and experimental conditions as values.

  • high_fidelity_arena (bool) ‚Äì whether to use high-fidelity arena detection. Recommended if light conditions

  • videos. (are uneven across) ‚Äì

  • interpolate_outliers (bool) ‚Äì whether to interpolate missing data.

  • interpolation_limit (int) ‚Äì maximum number of missing frames to interpolate.

  • interpolation_std (int) ‚Äì maximum number of standard deviations to interpolate.

  • likelihood_tol (float) ‚Äì likelihood threshold for outlier detection.

  • model (str) ‚Äì model to use for pose estimation. Defaults to ‚Äòmouse_topview‚Äô (as described in the documentation).

  • path (str) ‚Äì path to the folder containing the DLC output data.

  • smooth_alpha (float) ‚Äì smoothing intensity. The higher the value, the more smoothing.

  • table_format (str) ‚Äì format of the table. Defaults to ‚Äòautodetect‚Äô, but can be set to ‚Äúcsv‚Äù or ‚Äúh5‚Äù.

  • frame_rate (int) ‚Äì frame rate of the videos. If not specified, it will be inferred from the video files.

  • video_format (str) ‚Äì video format. Defaults to ‚Äò.mp4‚Äô.

property distancesÔÉÅ

List. If not ‚Äòall‚Äô, sets the body parts among which the distances will be computed

property egoÔÉÅ

String, name of a body part. If True, computes only the distances between the specified body part and the rest

property anglesÔÉÅ

Bool. Toggles angle computation. True by default. If turned off, enhances performance for big datasets

class deepof.data.Coordinates(arena: str, arena_detection: str, arena_dims: array, path: str, quality: dict, scales: ndarray, arena_params: List, tables: dict, trained_model_path: str, videos: List, video_resolution: List, angles: Optional[dict] = None, animal_ids: List = ('',), distances: Optional[dict] = None, exp_conditions: Optional[dict] = None)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Class for storing the results of a ran project. Methods are mostly setters and getters in charge of tidying up the generated tables.

Class for storing the results of a ran project. Methods are mostly setters and getters in charge of tidying up the generated tables.

Parameters:

  • arena (str) ‚Äì Type of arena used for the experiment. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • arena_detection (str) ‚Äì Type of arena detection used for the experiment. See deepof.data.Project for more

  • information. (See deepof.data.Project for more) ‚Äì

  • arena_dims (np.array) ‚Äì Dimensions of the arena. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • path (str) ‚Äì Path to the folder containing the results of the experiment.

  • quality (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary containing the quality of the experiment. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • scales (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Scales used for the experiment. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • arena_params (List) ‚Äì List containing the parameters of the arena. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • tables (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary containing the tables of the experiment. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • trained_model_path (str) ‚Äì Path to the trained models used for the supervised pipeline. For internal use only.

  • videos (List) ‚Äì List containing the videos used for the experiment. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • video_resolution (List) ‚Äì List containing the automatically detected resolution of the videos used for the experiment.

  • angles (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary containing the angles of the experiment. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • animal_ids (List) ‚Äì List containing the animal IDs of the experiment. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • distances (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary containing the distances of the experiment. See deepof.data.Project for more information.

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary containing the experimental conditions of the experiment.

  • information. ‚Äì

  • 3 (jerk if) ‚Äì

  • etc. ‚Äì

  • documentation). ((see preprocess in table_dict) ‚Äì

  • axis (selected body part with the y) ‚Äì

  • points (for all time) ‚Äì

  • selected_id (str) ‚Äì Selects a single animal on multi animal settings. Defaults to None (all animals are processed).

  • propagate_annotations (dict) ‚Äì If a dictionary is provided, supervised annotations are propagated through

  • traits. (the training dataset. This can be used for regularising the latent space based on already known) ‚Äì

supervised_annotation(params: Dict = {}, video_output: bool = False, frame_limit: int = inf, debug: bool = False, n_jobs: int = 1, propagate_labels: bool = False) → deepof_table_dictÔÉÅ

Annotates coordinates with behavioral traits using a supervised pipeline.

Parameters:

  • params (Dict) ‚Äì A dictionary with the parameters to use for the pipeline. If unsure, leave empty.

  • video_output (bool) ‚Äì It outputs a fully annotated video for each experiment indicated in a list. If set to

  • "all" ‚Äì

  • default. (it will output all videos. False by) ‚Äì

  • frame_limit (int) ‚Äì Only applies if video_output is not False. Indicates the maximum number of frames per

  • output. (video to) ‚Äì

  • debug (bool) ‚Äì Only applies if video_output is not False. If True, all videos will include debug information,

  • tags. (such as the detected arena and the preprocessed tracking) ‚Äì

  • n_jobs (int) ‚Äì Number of jobs to use for parallel processing.

  • propagate_labels (bool) ‚Äì If True, the pheno column will be propagated from the original data.

Returns:

A table_dict object with all supervised annotations per experiment as values.

Return type:

table_dict

static deep_unsupervised_embedding(preprocessed_object: Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray], embedding_model: str = 'VQVAE', batch_size: int = 64, latent_dim: int = 4, epochs: int = 150, log_history: bool = True, log_hparams: bool = False, n_components: int = 10, kmeans_loss: float = 1.0, output_path: str = 'unsupervised_trained_models', pretrained: str = False, save_checkpoints: bool = False, save_weights: bool = True, input_type: str = False, run: int = 0, strategy: Strategy = 'one_device', kl_annealing_mode: str = 'linear', kl_warmup: int = 15, reg_cat_clusters: float = 1.0) → TupleÔÉÅ

Annotates coordinates using a deep unsupervised autoencoder.

Parameters:

  • preprocessed_object (tuple) ‚Äì Tuple containing a preprocessed object (X_train, y_train, X_test, y_test).

  • embedding_model (str) ‚Äì Name of the embedding model to use. Must be one of VQVAE (default), GMVAE, or contrastive.

  • batch_size (int) ‚Äì Batch size for training.

  • latent_dim (int) ‚Äì Dimention size of the latent space.

  • epochs (int) ‚Äì Maximum number of epochs to train the model. Actual training might be shorter, as the model

  • decreasing. (will stop training when validation loss stops) ‚Äì

  • log_history (bool) ‚Äì Whether to log the history of the model to TensorBoard.

  • log_hparams (bool) ‚Äì Whether to log the hyperparameters of the model to TensorBoard.

  • n_components (int) ‚Äì Number of latent clusters for the embedding model to use.

  • kmeans_loss (float) ‚Äì Weight of the gram loss, which adds a regularization term to GMVAE and VQVAE models which

  • space. (penalizes the correlation between the dimensions in the latent) ‚Äì

  • output_path (str) ‚Äì Path to save the trained model and all log files.

  • pretrained (str) ‚Äì Whether to load a pretrained model. If False, model is trained from scratch. If not,

  • model. (must be the path to a saved) ‚Äì

  • save_checkpoints (bool) ‚Äì Whether to save checkpoints of the model during training. Defaults to False.

  • save_weights (bool) ‚Äì Whether to save the weights of the model during training. Defaults to True.

  • input_type (str) ‚Äì Type of the preprocessed_object passed as the first parameter. See deepof.data.TableDict

  • details. (for more) ‚Äì

  • run (int) ‚Äì Run number for the model. Used to save the model and log files. Optional.

  • strategy (tf.distribute.Strategy) ‚Äì Distributed strategy for TensorFloe to use. Must be one of ‚Äúone_device‚Äù,

  • "mirrored_strategy" (or) ‚Äì

  • "one_device". (as) ‚Äì

  • kl_annealing_mode (str) ‚Äì Mode of the KL annealing. Must be one of ‚Äúlinear‚Äù, or ‚Äúsigmoid‚Äù.

  • kl_warmup (int) ‚Äì Number of epochs to warm up the KL annealing.

  • reg_cat_clusters (bool) ‚Äì whether to use the penalize uneven cluster membership in the latent space, by

  • distribution. (minimizing the KL divergence between cluster membership and a uniform categorical) ‚Äì

Returns:

Tuple containing all trained models. See specific model documentation under deepof.models for details.

Return type:

Tuple

class deepof.data.TableDict(tabs: Dict, typ: str, arena: Optional[str] = None, arena_dims: Optional[array] = None, center: Optional[str] = None, polar: Optional[bool] = None, propagate_labels: bool = False, propagate_annotations: Union[Dict, bool] = False)ÔÉÅ

Bases: dict

Main class for storing a single dataset as a dictionary with individuals as keys and pandas.DataFrames as values. Includes methods for generating training and testing datasets for the autoencoders.

__init__(tabs: Dict, typ: str, arena: Optional[str] = None, arena_dims: Optional[array] = None, center: Optional[str] = None, polar: Optional[bool] = None, propagate_labels: bool = False, propagate_annotations: Union[Dict, bool] = False)ÔÉÅ

Main class for storing a single dataset as a dictionary with individuals as keys and pandas.DataFrames as values. Includes methods for generating training and testing datasets for the autoencoders.

Parameters:

  • tabs (Dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of pandas.DataFrames with individual experiments as keys.

  • typ (str) ‚Äì Type of the dataset. Examples are ‚Äúcoords‚Äù, ‚Äúdists‚Äù, and ‚Äúangles‚Äù. For logging purposes only.

  • arena (str) ‚Äì Type of the arena. Must be one of ‚Äúcircular-autodetect‚Äù, ‚Äúcircular-manual‚Äù, or ‚Äúpolygon-manual‚Äù. Handled internally.

  • arena_dims (np.array) ‚Äì Dimensions of the arena in mm.

  • center (str) ‚Äì Type of the center. Handled internally.

  • polar (bool) ‚Äì Whether the dataset is in polar coordinates. Handled internally.

  • propagate_labels (bool) ‚Äì Whether to propagate phenotypic labels from the original experiments to the

  • dataset. (of the individual experiments are propagated to the) ‚Äì

  • propagate_annotations (Dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of annotations to propagate. If provided, the supervised annotations

  • dataset. ‚Äì

random_projection(n_components: int = 2, kernel: str = 'linear') → Tuple[Any, Any]ÔÉÅ

Returns a training set generated from the 2D original data (time x features) and a random projection to a n_components space. The sample parameter allows the user to randomly pick a subset of the data for performance or visualization reasons.

Parameters:

  • n_components (int) ‚Äì Number of components to project to. Default is 2.

  • kernel (str) ‚Äì Kernel to be used for projections. Defaults to linear.

Returns:

Tuple containing projected data and projection type.

Return type:

tuple

preprocess(automatic_changepoints='rbf', window_size: int = 15, window_step: int = 1, scale: str = 'standard', test_videos: int = 0, verbose: int = 0, shuffle: bool = False, filter_low_variance: float = 0.001, interpolate_normalized: int = 5, precomputed_breaks: Optional[dict] = None) → ndarrayÔÉÅ

Main method for preprocessing the loaded dataset before feeding to unsupervised embedding models. Capable of returning training and test sets ready for model training.

Parameters:

  • automatic_changepoints (str) ‚Äì specifies the changepoint detection kernel to use to rupture the

  • "rbf" (data across time using Pelt. Can be set to) ‚Äì

  • appiled. ‚Äì

  • window_size (int) ‚Äì Minimum size of the applied ruptures. If automatic_changepoints is False,

  • instances. (specifies the size of the sliding window to pass through the data to generate training) ‚Äì

  • window_step (int) ‚Äì Specifies the minimum jump for the rupture algorithms. If automatic_changepoints is False,

  • case (specifies the step to take when sliding the aforementioned window. In this) ‚Äì

  • indicates (a value of 1) ‚Äì

  • window (a true sliding) ‚Äì

  • chunks. (and a value equal to to window_size splits the data into non-overlapping) ‚Äì

  • scale (str) ‚Äì Data scaling method. Must be one of ‚Äòstandard‚Äô (default; recommended) and ‚Äòminmax‚Äô.

  • test_videos (int) ‚Äì Number of videos to use for testing. If 0, no test set is generated.

  • verbose (int) ‚Äì Verbosity level. 0 (default) is silent, 1 prints progress, 2 prints debug information.

  • shuffle (bool) ‚Äì Whether to shuffle the data before preprocessing. Defaults to False.

  • filter_low_variance (float) ‚Äì remove features with variance lower than the specified threshold. Useful to

  • alignment (get rid of the x axis of the body part used for) ‚Äì

  • interpolate_normalized (int) ‚Äì if not 0, it specifies the number of standard deviations beyond which values will be

  • "standard". (interpolated after normalization. Only used if scale is set to) ‚Äì

  • precomputed_breaks (dict) ‚Äì If provided, changepoint detection is prevented, and provided breaks are used instead.

Returns:

3D dataset with shape (instances, sliding_window_size, features) generated from all training videos. y_train (np.ndarray): 3D dataset with shape (instances, sliding_window_size, labels) generated from all training videos. Note that no labels are use by default in the fully unsupervised pipeline (in which case this is an empty array). X_test (np.ndarray): 3D dataset with shape (instances, sliding_window_size, features) generated from all test videos (0 by default). y_test (np.ndarray): 3D dataset with shape (instances, sliding_window_size, labels) generated from all test videos. Note that no labels are use by default in the fully unsupervised pipeline (in which case this is an empty array).

Return type:

X_train (np.ndarray)
